wikipedia_page.main: Bruno Bianco Alberto G. G. Barnabe (3 April 1905 – June 1998) was an English film and stage actor. He performed in the West End, on Broadway, and in Egypt, Australia and New Zealand.

response: * Bruno Barnabe as Umayyah ibn Khalaf

The Mummy's Shroud is set in 1920 and tells the story of a team of archaeologists who come across the lost tomb of the boy Pharaoh Kah-To-Bey (Toolsie Persaud). The story begins with a flash back sequence to Ancient Egypt and we see the story of how Prem (Dickie Owen), a manservant of Kah-To-Bey, spirited away the boy when his father (Bruno Barnabe) was killed in a palace coup and took him into the desert for protection. Unfortunately, the boy dies and is buried.

response: * Bruno Barnabe (1905–1998), English film and stage actor

A Broadway revival in 1967 starred Priscilla Morrill and Denholm Elliott as Laura and Alec."Tonight at 8.30", Internet Broadway Database. Retrieved 4 April 2020 Fay Compton led an Australian tour in 1937–38 in three plays from Tonight at 8.30; in Still Life she played Laura to Bruno Barnabe's Alec."Coward Plays", The Age, 1 December 1937, p. 15
She was married to the actor Bruno Barnabe (1905–1998). She retired from acting in 1972 and died in 1976, aged 65, from undisclosed causes.
